instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.CPUVR_PGOOD: What is CPUVR_PGOOD? CPU_VR_PGOOD Is a signal present when CPU_VR_EN is presenT. CPU_VR_PGOOD is a prerequisite along with ALL_SYS_PWRGD to create PM_S0_PGOOD and PM_PCH_PWROK and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK which are necessary for the machine to turn on and boot..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP2V7_NAND: What is PP2V7_NAND? PP2V7_NAND is a power rail that powers the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on Macbooks with soldered on storage and must be present for the SSD to show up. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message:
This 2019 Air board is at 20V USB-C (0.02A) with PPBUS at 12.6V. No signs of liquid damage.

It enters DFU mode but any T2 firmware restore attempt ends with error 9, even with connected good battery and Apple charger.

No shorts on the big coils or the small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>. I am missing the S5 power rails as well as <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL>. Also missing are some of the power-good input signals into <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>: <SIGNAL>PVCCIO_PGOOD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CPUVR_PGOOD</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>PVDDQ_PGOOD</SIGNAL>. 

Anything else to check before I blame this on a faulty T2 chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message: Do you have any hints for how to get a reflashing setup started? What's the best way to be able to handle different sizes of chips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message:
This may help you.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a-tries-to-turn-on-and-restarts.63514/page-2#post-97081[/URL]

Try to read all the threads in the forum, not only personal ones; at least the recent posts.
You may find interesting information...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message: I reflashed the SoC ROM, but subsequent DFU Restore attempts still fail, this time with a different error (below). Now the board is in perpetual DFU mode, with PPBUS between 11.5 - 12.3V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message:
Force the machine off first.
Then try DFU keys combination again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message: When I force the machine off with the power button, it disappears in Apple Configurator for a second, then immediately reappears with the DFU icons on its own.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message: Try again with original SoC ROM dump.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message:
I confirmed on another machine that the persistent DFU mode is the default state after reflashing the SoC ROM. The board enters DFU mode as soon as power is applied, ready for a DFU Restore.

On this particular board, DFU Restore fails (I think) because I'm missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message:
I got several times SSD voltages after DFU revive/restore.
So DFU should fix it; unless is caused by another problem, not T2 corruption.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message: When I revert to this board's original SoC ROM dump, I still get the above error ("added from invalid state Restoring") during Restore attempts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message:
[QUOTE="sekidata, post: 98285, member: 28264"]
When I revert to this board's original SoC ROM dump, I still get the above error ("added from invalid state") during Restore attempts.
[/QUOTE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 Air not starting up
threads.message:
You may have SSD problem, or T2 itself.
Check for short on all secondary power supplies, from S4 to S0.
